page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Before the first world war the Remount depot was changed into Tank Repair and Recovery Organisation.On October the 1st 1942 R.E.M.E was formed (Royal Electrical Mechanical Engineers).They took over the responsability for repair and recovery of all the army equipment. In 1961 two training battalions came together to form the S.E.E. Hazelbrook Barracks.There are three smaller units,R.E.M.E. Oficers school,Headquarters R.E.M.E. And 45 Squadron Royal Corps of Transport. The population of the garrison has now risen to 6000 which includes familys and soldiers.The ameneties in the garrison caters for most peoples needs ie. Comunity centre, creche, library, sports hall swimming pool and youth club.Approximtely 50% of the children go to Arborfield school.
